item.title: Imagination, Patterns, and Patience with Perler Beads
item.description: If you grew up in the 80s or 90s, there’s a good chance you’re familiar with Perler beads already. Growing up, we called them Perler beads, but they seem to go by many other different names now too, such as Hama beads, fuse beads, and melty beads. I bought a big bucket of them for my daughters about a year ago. If I’m being honest, I bought them for my own enjoyment as much as for the kids, and they have led to countless hours of fun as the girls sift and sort through the beads to find just the right colors and carefully place each one.
